Player History
Drafted in 2nd round, 36th overall pick, by Toledo in 1964...
Traded from Toledo to Boston (UBA) on 6/20/1964 (Going to PIL: LF E. Auman, P J. Hillhouse. Going to TOL: P M. Houghton)...
Had first career hit (double) on 4/2/1970, off Jacques Griffin (PEN)...
Hit first career homerun on 4/23/1970, off James Carino (TRO)...
Had 5 hits with 3 RBI against Troy on 5/29/1971...
Was selected to the 1974 Allstar game...
Injured on 8/21/1975 with a Tight Elbow, out for 1-2 weeks...
Drove in 6 runs against Diablo on 6/14/1978...
Won Player of the Week award on 7/28/1979, hitting .471 with 2 HR, 9 RBI...
Had 30-game hitting streak snapped on 5/27/1980...
Won Player of the Week award on 6/2/1980, hitting .545 with 2 HR, 7 RBI...
Drove in 6 runs against Coney Island on 8/10/1981...
